page.title: 16Making Vehicles in Guildford
page.content: {Hestair Dennis}is the largest single employer in the area, manufacturing fire engines, refuse carts, lorries & bus chassis.{Fire engines,}its main product, take 12 weeks to complete. They are sold all over the UK and the Middle and Far East. Raw materials are British and West German. The Dennis brothers began their bicycle company in 1895, soon progressing to motorised tricycles and cars, later specialising in commercial vehicles. The publicity surrounding Raymond's Â£1 fine for speeding at 16 mph in a company car launched the firm and in 1905 they moved to the present 37 acre site. The current work force of 790, comprises 425 engineers, 127 shop floor workers and 238 office staff. Great reductions in space and workers will take place in 1986, when a property company builds DIY hypermarkets on the site.
